newsitem.title: RUSSIA: PRESS DIGEST - RUSSIA IZVESTIA - MAY 15.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - RUSSIA IZVESTIA - MAY 15.

text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in the May 16 edition of Russia's Izvestia newspaper. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Parliament has decided to audit the financial accounts of Russia's natural monopolies, apparently to establish control over the two first deputy prime ministers, says the paper.
- We are ready to coexist with an expanded NATO but on our conditions, says the paper in reference to the agreement reached between Russia and NATO on their future relations.
- About 120 top military officials may face charges of corruption and this is only the top on the iceberg says the newspaper in connection with an appointment of new military prosecutor general.
- Moscow authorities are planning to spend 40 billion roubles to arrange children's leisure in summer as part of a Russian interior ministry project to alleviate the plight of neglected children.
- Two miners of Kiselyovsk in Russia's coal region in Siberia blew themselves up, driven to despair by being unable to support their families. They had not been paid since last August.
